Description: Textile fragment; long rectangle of linen cloth; medium-fine quality. Plain with a pink tinge where it is unfaded - traces of safflower dye(?). Some green-ish stains and small brown stains are present. Edges are torn; fraying at the sides. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.28 ends per 10mm and weft 15 picks per 10mm.
Curator's comments: This cloth was presumably from a mummy, as wear is not obvious. Some of the threads have a flattened look as if the folded cloth had been pressed down. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1992]
